meanings.definition: Capable of being demonstrated or shown to be true.
meanings.sent1: The experiment provided provable evidence of the theory.
meanings.sent2: The scientist conducted tests to determine if the hypothesis was provable.
meanings.sent3: It was quite provable that the cat had stolen the cookie from the jar.
meanings.sent4: Her success was as provable as the sun rising every morning.
meanings.sent5: The detective needed provable facts to solve the case.

meanings.definition: Able to be proven or verified.
meanings.sent1: The witness's testimony was not provable in court.
meanings.sent2: The data collected was provable through multiple experiments.
meanings.sent3: It seemed almost provable that the dog could speak English.
meanings.sent4: His loyalty was as provable as the strength of an oak tree.
meanings.sent5: The authenticity of the painting was provable by the artist's signature.
